title: Wrongfully Banned
body:
My name is Stephanie, and I am a support main who has been playing League since about season 1. IGN: loveroo I am involved in Facebook groups about League, and we often have in-house games together. This weekend, I was playing in one of these in-houses. During the last game I played, my client was acting really buggy. My ping was fine, but my friend suggested trying to lower the graphics of the game to see if it helped. No matter what I did, nothing seemed to fix the client. It was very laggy, and sound was stuttering. I had no programs open besides League. Not even a voice comm. I never have problems playing. I decided to restart my pc. Once I tried to log back onto League, I was met with a perma-ban for scripting. Mind you, I barely can use Skype. I am probably the most technology impaired gamer you will ever meet. I play champions like Nami, Janna, and Zyra. I am in Gold 4, and pride myself on being one of the least toxic people I know of in the community. I emailed Riot, assuring them that this was a mistake. The email I got back was a very generic response saying: 

Hey there,

I'm ****** and I'm part of the Riot Support team. Our system has accurate evidence that your account was in violation of our Terms of Use due to the usage of scripts, hacks, exploits or unauthorized third-party programs in the game. After I double checked your account, it doesn't look like this was a mistake.

For security purposes on our investigative methods, I will not be sharing more detailed evidence or specific details. We will not be lifting the ban on this account under any circumstances.

I then messaged him back. Told him that this is clearly a mistake, and automated. That I have never done anything, let alone have the know-how to perform any violations as such. This was my next reply:

Hello,

In situations like this, we only take action against accounts when we are absolutely sure of our evidence. We also personally review every case like this to make sure that we haven't made any sort of error and I personally looked into this situation.

I understand that this isn't the answer you're looking for but given the evidence we have, we can't justify lifting the suspension on this account.

I absolutely, 100%, have NEVER EVER violated any terms of service. When I am running League, the only thing I ever have up is Facebook. Sometimes. I don't usually use voice comms. I dont know code or html. I dont evne fully understand what scripting is. I know it has to do with cheating/skill shots/dodging. I do not understand how there can be any evidence against me when I have never had an affiliation with this type of thing.

Please help.

replies.body: {{champion:267}} Locking a necro.

Do you know or believe someone else has had access to your League account, whether you authorized it or not?

Do you play on a shared computer at any point?

Did you get your client files transferred from someone else rather than downloading it from the website?

Do you have any cheat programs used for other games, or have any program that modified League in any way at any point (including resolution adjustments)?

Has your email account registered to this account been compromised before?

Do you use the same or similar login information for League as you do elsewhere?

Just a few reasons that could explain an account compromised which resulted in flagging a hack/mod/exploit you were unaware of.

I have my own pc, it is not shared. I barely go on it. The only reason why I go on my pc is to play League, or if there is something I NEED to use a desktop for. 

I don't understand what you mean by client files transferred? 

I have never used cheats in my life. Even on the old school systems like PS1. So, no. There is no program/cheat/code/anything on my pc that could be mistaken as such. The only game I currently play is League of Legends.

My email accounts are constantly being compromised due to an internet stalker I have had for about ten years. I also mentioned that in my emails with Riot about the ban. I believe that person has made an account, added me, and then attempted to talk to me. He asked if he could send me money/buy me RP, and I would ignore him. All of my accounts have 2 step verification. I also have the LoLSumo app on my phone, and check it regularly. I do not see any games that could have been somebody else getting into my account.

My log in information on League is not the same I use for anything else.

I didn't even know until recently you could download game. The other day I was poking around my profile, and saw you can upload highlights. I went to do so, but the games saved on my pc are called rofl files and they cannot be opened. It's the only access I have of game play that can potentially prove my innocence. I just have no idea how to open it.

.rofl files are replays of the spectator data for your matches, and you have to pull them up through the (updated) League client, or you can [perform the workaround explained here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/2JWmR6sF-replays-are-live-in-the-new-client-faq-pro-tips?comment=000a00000000). You don't need to show that to Riot though, they can see match data from their end in detail, and it wouldn't be needed for this anyway. Not really relevant to this case, but to .rofl replays, they can only be used during the patch they were recorded from.

As for your email compromises, that could've had something to do with it. You might need some professional assistance to deal with a stalker if this has been going on for 10 years, but explaining some details to player support in your [ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) may be useful to them when handling your case.

I did tell them in my email. I mentioned that the messages are still up on my client, so they could identify the IGN of that person, and an email attached. I have tried to get authorities involved, but nobody will do anything about it because it is just online. This person hides their ip address. Makes new accounts constantly, let it be emails, skype names, facebook profiles, etc. They have never threatened my life. They have never made themselves known to me in person. They just harass me. If I am in a relationship, they harass my boyfriend. I have enlisted tech savvy friends to try and track this person down, but I keep getting told, "this guy is good" and that "he knows what hes doing". I'm at a loss.

If you give me their IGN, a few of their emails or something, I could have a shot at finding out who they are, live etc. I'm quite experienced in hacking, and if they do have a VPN, SSH Tunnel or something else of the sorts I could try to back-trace it.
I also got wrongfully banned for third party applications, which sucks, considering I don't even play well enough to be using any scripts lmao.
Message me if you want me looking into this stalker situation. :)
You open them through the client, they have to be on the same patch as the client, and they would not contain any proof or evidence of scripting.

I tried to? This was a couple days ago. I never saw the feature. The client showed where my files were saved on my pc, so I double clicked them to try to watch. I couldn't. rofl files and what not. I have never scripted lol so nothing would have evidence of that. One of the two games I have on there is from this week.

It's likely this stalker/hacker was able to get your League password and login on their computer with hacks to compromise your account.

OR

Stealthily install hacks on your computer.

Check your installed software for anything strange or out of the ordinary. Run anti-virus and anti-malware software, scan your whole PC.

Make sure no one else has the password to your computer login (windows I'm assuming).

Never ever log in to League on a public gaming PC or anyone else's League client/PC that isn't completely 100% checked for hacks/3rd party software.
